title: New: Coasts – Oceans
content:
Following the 2010 breakout of mancunian heavy-poppers WU LYF, it became a real possibility that their individuality and creativity would spark the uprising of a new wave of honest, original guitar bands.

Although a few copycats were to be expected, the endless drivel rolled out by the conveyor-belt of indie music came as a slight surprise.

From the cliché beach romance to the haircuts and ankle-length chinos, Coasts prove once again that musical substance is no longer a requirement in the modern indie game. With lyrics so blatantly torn out of a 12-year-old girl’s diary, their growing fan base truly highlights the necessity of an expensive PR team. Intriguingly accompanied by the enlightening slogan: “World, this is Oceans. Oceans, this is the world.”, it appears all hope is, in fact, lost.
author: 5e9b68b27a1236eccfeb1d45
